433 In Japan, cleanliness isn’t just a duty it’s a reflection of their culture and identity. posted 6 hours ago by MEME-SUPREME 42 comments award share report block Massimo @Rainmaker1973 • 14h In Japan, cleanliness isn’t just a duty it’s a reflection of their culture and identity. [🎞️ insightgemz]

They have a sense of honor and take pride in their country and their environment.  Even the garbage trucks are spotless. permalink award report block reply rivetjoint2 6 points 5 hours ago Japan? Say there is an abandoned building, but it's clean.  No graffiti, no broken windows, no dirt or debris. Down the street there is another abandoned building, but this one is the opposite. Graffiti, broken windows, etc. A delinquent would be more likely to continue to vandalize the second one since others have already done so. But to be the first one to throw a rock or tag with spray paint not only requires a bit of extra courage, but might bring unwanted attention to themselves since someone is obviously keeping an eye one the place. Order encourages order and chaos encourages chaos. permalink award report block reply pococurante 1 points 1 hour ago Decades of Democrat mayors turned NYC into a filthy dump that people treated like a dump.
